Module jtrim.stream
Package org.jtrim2.stream

Interface SeqConsumer<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements to be processed
public interface SeqConsumer<T>
Defines an action processing a sequence of elements. If you need to process multiple sequences of elements, then please see SeqGroupConsumer, or if the processing is context free (i.e., you don't need to do anything before and after processing the sequence), then you might want to implement ElementConsumer instead for simplicity.

The consumer must always start consuming the input stream (unless it fails with an exception before that), and must only consume it exactly once.

Note that this interface can be conveniently implemented by a lambda. For example: 


 Path destFile = ...;
 SeqConsumer<String> consumer = (cancelToken, seqProducer) -> {
   try (Writer writer = Files.newBufferedWriter(destFile, StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) {
     seqProducer.transferAll(cancelToken, element -> {
       cancelToken.checkCanceled();
       writer.write(element + "\n");
     });
   }
 };
The above example writes each elements of the input stream into separate lines of destFile while properly opening the file only once before the stream processing, and the closing the file as appropriate.

Thread safety

The thread-safety property of this interface are completely implementation dependent.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • ElementConsumer
  • SeqGroupConsumer

  • Method Details

    • draining

      static <T> SeqConsumer<T> draining()
      Returns a consumer consuming the whole input stream and doing nothing with the elements.

      The returns consumer is reusable any number of times.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements to be processed
      Returns:
      a consumer consuming the whole input stream and doing nothing with the elements. This method never returns null.

    • fromElementConsumer

      static <T> SeqConsumer<T> fromElementConsumer(ElementConsumer<? super T> consumer)
      Returns a SeqConsumer passing the processed elements to the given ElementConsumer.

      The returned consumer's reusability is the same as the mapper given in the argument. Note however, that is not normally feasible to pass a non-reusable mapper.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements to be processed
      Parameters:
      consumer - the consumer to which elements are forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a SeqConsumer passing the processed elements to the given ElementConsumer. This method never returns null.

    • flatteningConsumer

      static <T, C extends Iterable<? extends T>> SeqConsumer<C> flatteningConsumer(SeqConsumer<? super T> dest)
      Returns a consumer processing a stream of Iterable instances, and delegating the elements of the collection to the given destination consumer in the iteration order of the collection. For example, if the input stream is [[0, 1, 2], [3, 4]], then the elements sent to the given destination consumer are [0, 1, 2, 3, 4] (in this order).

      The returned consumer is reusability is the same as the consumer given in the argument.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements to be processed by the destination consumer
      C - the type of the Iterable (e.g., List)
      Parameters:
      dest - the destination consumer processing the elements of each collection of the input stream. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a consumer processing a stream of collections, and delegating the elements of the collection to the given destination consumer. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • FluentSeqConsumer.apply
      • FluentSeqProducer.batch

    • consumeAll

      void consumeAll(CancellationToken cancelToken, SeqProducer<? extends T> seqProducer) throws Exception
      Processes all the elements of the given producer. This method must consume the elements of the given producer exactly once, unless it fails before even attempting it once. This method must assume that the provided producer is no longer usable once this method returns.

      Exceptions thrown by the provided seqProducer must be propagated to the caller, and must not be wrapped (with the exception of checked exceptions not implementing Exception).

      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the cancellation token which should be checked if the processing is to be canceled before completing the whole processing. There is no guarantee that the implementation will detect the cancellation request, but a well-behaved implementation should make a best effort check, if it does some lengthy operation. If cancellation was detected by this call, then it must respond by throwing an OperationCanceledException. This argument cannot be null.
      seqProducer - the producer whose elements are to be consumed. This argument cannot be null
      Throws:
      OperationCanceledException - thrown if cancellation of the stream processing was detected by this method call
      Exception - thrown if there was a processing failure. This usually means that the whole processing of the stream is to be discontinued.

    • toFluent

      default FluentSeqConsumer<T> toFluent()
      Returns a convenient fluent builder to create a complex processing action starting out from this consumer.

      Implementation note: This method has an appropriate default implementation, and there is normally no reason to override it.

      Returns:
      a convenient fluent builder to create a complex processing action. This method never returns null.
